item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "Sometimes I think it is a great mistake to have matter that can think and feel. It complains so. By the same token, though, I suppose that boulders and mountains and moons could be accused of being a little too phlegmatic." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I was a victim of a series of accidents, as are we all." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ben add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Ben add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "So far, about morals, I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Ben add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Ben add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ben add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ben add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Ben add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Arguing with anonymous strangers on the Internet is a sucker's game because they almost always turn out to be&mdash;or to be indistinguishable from&mdash;self-righteous sixteen-year-olds possessing infinite amounts of free time." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Ben add a quote by Leon Bloy
item.description: "Any Christian who is not a hero is a pig." -- Leon Bloy

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ben Franklin
item.description: "There was never a bad peace or a good war." -- Ben Franklin

item.title: Ben add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "One of the greatest tragedies in mankind's entire history may be that morality was hijacked by religion." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Ben add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description:
"All Creatures know that some must die That all the rest may take and eat; Sooner or later, all transform Their blood to wine, their flesh to meat.
But Man alone seeks Vengefulness, And writes his abstract Laws on stone; For this false Justice he has made, He tortures limb and crushes bone.
Is this the image of a god? My tooth for yours, your eye for mine? Oh, if Revenge did move the stars Instead of Love, they would not shine." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Ben add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Ben add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Religion. It's given people hope in a world torn apart by religion." -- Jon Stewart
